tuv.seg: My father
我的父亲
My father was a self-taught mandolin player. He was one of the best string instrument players in our town.
我父亲是个自学成才的曼陀林琴手，他是我们镇最优秀的弦乐演奏者之一。
He could not read music, but if he heard a tune a few times, he could play it.
他看不懂乐谱，但是如果听几次曲子，他就能演奏出来。
When he was younger, he was a member of a small country music band.
当他年轻一点的时候，他是一个小乡村乐队的成员。
They would play at local dances and on a few occasions would play for the local radio station.
他们在当地舞厅演奏，有几次还为当地广播电台演奏。
He often told us how he had auditioned and earned a position in a band that featured Patsy Cline as their lead singer.
他经常告诉我们，自己如何试演，如何在佩茜克莱恩作为主唱的乐队里占一席之位。
He told the family that after he was hired he never went back.
他告诉家人，一旦被聘用就永不回头。
Dad was a very religious man. He stated that there was a lot of drinking and cursing the day of his audition and he did not want to be around that type of environment.
父亲是一个很严谨的人，他讲述了他试演的那天，很多人在喝酒，咒骂，他不想呆在那种环境里。
Occasionally, Dad would get out his mandolin and play for the family.
偶尔地，爸爸会拿出他的曼陀林，为家人演奏。
We three children: Trisha, Monte and I, George Jr., would often sing along. Songs such as the Tennessee Waltz, Harbor Lights and around Christmas time, the well-known rendition of Silver Bells.
我们家一共有三个孩子：特丽莎，蒙特，和我，小乔治常常一个人唱歌，如田纳西华尔兹，夕阳下的赤帆，在圣诞期间，还有著名的叮叮当。
"Silver Bells, Silver Bells, its Christmas time in the city" would ring throughout the house.
“叮叮当，叮叮当，圣诞来临了”的歌声响彻屋子。
One of Dad's favorite hymns was "The Old Rugged Cross".
爸爸最喜欢的歌就是“古旧十架”。
We learned the words to the hymn when we were very young, and would sing it with Dad when he would play and sing.
我们很小的时候，就知道了这首歌，和爸爸一起演奏歌唱。
Another song that was often shared in our house was a song that accompanied the Walt Disney series: Davey Crockett.
我们常唱的另一首歌就是华特迪士尼精选系列：戴维·克罗克特。
Dad only had to hear the song twice before he learned it well enough to play it.
爸爸在学会这首歌之前，只听过这首歌两次。
"Davey, Davey Crockett, King of the Wild Frontier" was a favorite song for the family.
“戴维，戴维克罗克特，荒野边疆的国王”是我们家最喜欢的歌。
He knew we enjoyed the song and the program and would often get out the mandolin after the program was over.
他知道我们很喜欢这首歌，所以通常在曼陀林演奏完之后，就是这个节目。
I could never get over how he could play the songs so well after only hearing them a few times.
我永远也想不出他怎么能在只听过几遍就能把曲子弹得如此好。
I loved to sing, but I never learned how to play the mandolin.
我喜欢唱歌，但是我从来没有学过如何弹奏曼陀林。
This is something I regret to this day.
这是我的遗憾。
Dad loved to play the mandolin for his family he knew we enjoyed singing, and hearing him play.
爸爸喜欢为家人弹奏曼陀林，他知道我们喜欢唱歌，喜欢听他弹奏。
He was like that.
他喜欢这样。
If he could give pleasure to others, he would, especially his family.
只要能给他人带来快乐，尤其是他的家人，他就去做。
He was always there, sacrificing his time and efforts to see that his family had enough in their life.
他总是那样，牺牲自己的时间和精力让家人生活的满足。
I had to mature into a man and have children of my own before I realized how much he had sacrificed.
父亲的这种付出是只有当我长大成人，而且是有了自己的孩子后才能体会到的。
I joined the United States Air Force in January of 1962.
1962年1月我参加了美国空军。
Whenever I would come home on leave, I would ask Dad to play the mandolin.
每当我休假回家，我都会让爸爸弹奏曼陀林。
Nobody played the mandolin like my father. He could touch your soul with the tones that came out of that old mandolin.
没有人弹奏曼陀林能达到像我父亲那样的境界，他在那古老的曼陀林上抚出的旋律能够触及你的灵魂。
He seemed to shine when he was playing.
他弹奏的时候，身上似乎能发出四射的光芒。
You could see his pride in his ability to play so well for his family.
你可以看出，父亲为能给家人弹奏出如此美妙的旋律，他是多么的自豪。
When Dad was younger, he worked for his father on the farm.
父亲年轻的时候，曾在农场为爷爷工作。
His father was a farmer and sharecropped a farm for the man who owned the property.
爷爷租用农场，要向农场主人交纳谷物抵租。
In 1950, our family moved from the farm. Dad had gained employment at the local limestone quarry.
1950年，我们全家搬离农场，父亲在当地石灰石采石场谋得职位。
When the quarry closed in August of 1957, he had to seek other employment.
采石场在1957年倒闭，他只好另觅工作。
He worked for Owens Yacht Company in Dundalk, Maryland and for Todd Steel in Point of Rocks, Maryland.
他曾在马里兰州登多克的欧文斯游艇公司上班，还在马里兰州的洛斯的托德钢铁公司上过班。
While working at Todd Steel, he was involved in an accident.
而工作在托德钢，他被卷入了一场事故。
His job was to roll angle iron onto a conveyor so that the welders farther up the production line would have it to complete their job.
他的工作是把有棱角的铁滚到搬运台上，这样焊接工才能作进一步加工来完成整个工序。
On this particular day Dad got the third index finger of his left hand mashed between two pieces of steel.
突然有一天，父亲的左手第三个手指被夹在两片钢铁中。
The doctor who operated on the finger could not save it, and Dad ended up having the tip of the finger amputated.
医生对手指施手术，但未能保住那只手指，最后父亲只好让医生把那手指的指尖给切除了。
He didn't lose enough of the finger where it would stop him picking up anything, but it did impact his ability to play the mandolin.
那个手指并没有完全丧失拿东西的能力，但是却影响了他弹奏曼陀林的能力。
After the accident, Dad was reluctant to play the mandolin.
那件事之后，爸爸不愿再弹曼陀林了。
He felt that he could not play as well as he had before the accident.
他认为他弹得不能像以前一样好了。
When I came home on leave and asked him to play he would make excuses for why he couldn't play.
当我休假回家，让父亲弹奏时，他总是找各种各样的理由拒绝。
Eventually, we would wear him down and he would say "Okay, but remember, I can't hold down on the strings the way I used to" or "Since the accident to this finger I can't play as good".
最终，我们会说服他，他会说“好吧，但是记住，我不能像以前那样弹了”或者“那场事故后，那根手指弹得不像以前一样好了”。
For the family it didn't make any difference that Dad couldn't play as well. We were just glad that he would play.
对于家人来说，父亲弹得好不好并没有分别，我们很高兴他终于弹奏了。
When he played the old mandolin it would carry us back to a cheerful, happier time in our lives.
当他弹起那把陈旧的曼陀林，就会把我们带回昔日那些无忧无虑的幸福时光。
"Davey, Davey Crockett, King of the Wild Frontier", would again be heard in the little town of Bakerton, West Virginia.
“戴维，戴维克罗克特，荒野边疆的国王”就会再次响彻西弗吉尼亚州的贝克顿小镇。
In August of 1993 my father was diagnosed with inoperable lung cancer.
1993年8月，我父亲被确诊为不能动手术的肺癌。
He chose not to receive chemotherapy treatments so that he could live out the rest of his life in dignity.
他不想接受化疗，因为他想体面地过完他生命最后的时光。
About a week before his death, we asked Dad if he would play the mandolin for us.
他去世前一周，我们问爸爸是否能为我们弹奏曼陀林。
He knew it would probably be the last time he would play for us. He tuned up the old mandolin and played a few notes.
他知道这可能是他最后一次为我们弹奏了，他为老曼陀林调弦，弹了几个音。
When I looked around, there was not a dry eye in the family.
当我放眼望去，我们家人都泪流满面。
We saw before us a quiet humble man with an inner strength that comes from knowing God, and living with him in one's life.
我们看见，在我们面前的是一个安静、谦虚的人，用生命中最后的力量，用爱支撑着。
Dad would never play the mandolin for us again.
爸爸再也不会为我们弹曼陀林。
We felt at the time that he wouldn't have enough strength to play, and that makes the memory of that day even stronger.
那时，我们感觉他已经没有足够的力量，为我们弹奏，这让我们的记忆更加深刻。
Dad was doing something he had done all his life, giving.
父亲的一生都在做的事情：奉献。
As sick as he was, he was still pleasing others.
即使生病，他还在取悦他人。
Dad sure could play that Mandolin!
爸爸绝对是在谱写曼陀林的真谛！
